data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

When you start a new exercise by facing forward you take 7 steps forward. When starting a new exercise by facing right you take 9 steps right. If you go backwards you take 10 steps backward. Thus, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
While at first you must wait to turn around, you must turn right again. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 10 steps unless you start from the beginning and then repeat the process taking 4 steps per step, then 2 steps per step. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

A man is in a chair and requires 7 steps to get back to a point. Turn left to return to his starting point. If you go reverse of the instructions you make it back in reverse order so the steps are 2 steps each time. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Turning left is the first motion. If you turn left back to the starting point. Turning left is the second motion. Is turning around the first or the second motion? Turn right. So they are instructions. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You would turn around and take 7 steps in the first direction. The starting point would be in the direction you have traveled. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
There is no turning right and turning left with these 2 steps, so one can move back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

This is a list of instructions. It is not necessary to turn around in order to return to the starting point. In order to return to the starting point you need at least 2 more steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person usually stays facing forward while facing the direction of journey in which action is being taken. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
It takes 7 steps to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
One step backward is part of the instructions to take 3 steps forward. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The first step to this direction is always backward. The second step is always forward. The third step is always to the right. The fourth step is always to the left. The fifth step is always to the left. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you follow each step from the first step, you must still face forward. If you follow the first step from the left, you must now face right. Therefore, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you are going from one place to another while facing forward, these directions are the same. Take 4 steps left. It does not say you take 3 steps forward or 1 step right. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Removing the step forward will return you the starting point, so you don' t have to do any of the steps from the start point. These instructions are given as direction of travel, so facing forward. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Turn right. Turn around. Turn left. Take 4 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person turns around and takes 4 steps back to one's starting point. In order to take 8 steps, you would take 8 steps x 4 steps = 40 steps. The answer: No.

If you follow the instructions from step 1 to step 3, then you walk and return to the starting point. There are 9 steps you take to return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn around means return home. Turn around means turning around back. The first step is a 7 step return to home. The second is 9 step turn around back to home. True/False 7 steps return to home. So, the answer is yes.

It takes 7 steps for you to return to the starting point. It takes 2 steps to step around and back. So, the answer is No.

You return to the starting point by turning right from the first direction again. So, the answer is Yes.

Take an additional 3 steps to return to the starting point. Turn left 1 step and take 6 steps. So, the answer is yes.

In order to turn around you take 10 steps. You can do a step move like this or a turn that take two steps. So, the answer is yes.

One set of instructions is to take 3 steps, turn around, and take 7 steps. So, the answer is yes.

Step forward 7 steps left 2 steps right 5 steps backward 7 steps forward 7 steps left 2 steps right take 9 steps forward. So, the answer is No.

Once you face forward you take the first step backward. In order to go backward and to come back to your starting point you must return to that point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you turn around by 4 steps, you come back the same way you came, except you have to take 4 steps back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

A person always takes one step forward. To return to the starting point, they take 6 steps backwards. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

To turn a vehicle right, you can only take 5 steps in a circle. If you turn left and take 4 steps, you can only turn around in the same circle. Being turn right and taking 5 steps are the same steps but are different directions of turning. So, the answer is yes.

If you always face forward you can go 8 steps forward. If you always face backward you can go 2 steps backward. So, the answer is No.

You would go back to the starting point if you took a single step. So, the answer is No.

No, you can only walk back 9 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you always face forward you would only make backwards steps. If you faced backwards you would make up and take a little more steps forward. So, the answer is no.

If you always face forward you can return to the starting point from the right. In the above picture, you take 5 steps left and 1 step backward. If you always face forward you can go to the starting point from the right. So, the answer is No.

If you go to the starting point only twice and every time you come back, you leave. The set of instructions does not tell you it is a negative count, so it's true of any number of places. So, the answer is No.

One cannot take backwards and forward. If you want to go leftward, then you take 2 steps left. If you want to go right, then you take 10 steps right. If you want to go leftward, then you take 4 steps forward. So, the answer is No.
